heroDescription: The Indo-Japan Chamber of Commerce (IJCC) is a premier bilateral chamber fostering economic, cultural, and educational ties between India and Japan.
homeAboutUsDescription: The Indo-Japan Chamber of Commerce (IJCC) was formed with a view to promoting closer economic relations between India and Japan. The Chamber has facilitated several business interactions, forged partnerships, and promoted bilateral trade over the years. We work to enhance trade relations, attract investment, and create platforms for business success in both countries.
whyJoinUsDescription: Explore the tools and resources we offer to help your business thrive and expand its horizons across borders.
feature1Description: Stay updated with our interactive calendar of upcoming events, seminars, and workshops. Plan your participation and network with industry leaders from both India and Japan. Never miss an opportunity to connect.
feature2Description: Connect with a diverse network of professionals, businesses, and organizations. Our comprehensive directory helps you find partners, clients, and collaborators to foster growth and innovation.
feature3Description: Access a rich repository of documents, JLPT papers, market reports, and presentations. Enhance your knowledge and stay ahead of the curve with our curated collection of valuable resources.
feature4Description: Become a part of our thriving community. Get in touch with us for any inquiries, support, or to start your membership application today and unlock a world of opportunities.
associatePartnersDescription: We are proud to collaborate with a diverse network of partners and members.
ctaTitle: Ready to Foster Stronger Business Ties?
ctaDescription: Become a part of our growing network. Get in touch with us to learn more about membership benefits.
footerCopyright: Indo-Japan Chamber of Commerce. All rights reserved.
aboutTitle: About The Indo-Japan Chamber of Commerce
aboutSubtitle: Forging powerful partnerships and fostering economic growth between India and Japan for over five decades.
aboutPara1: The Indo-Japan Chamber of Commerce (IJCC) was formed with a view to promoting closer economic relations between India and Japan. The Chamber has facilitated several business interactions, forged partnerships, and promoted bilateral trade over the years. We work to enhance trade relations, attract investment, and create platforms for business success in both countries.
aboutPara2: Our journey began over 50 years ago, driven by a vision to create a robust platform for Indo-Japanese economic cooperation. Today, we stand as a testament to the enduring friendship and burgeoning business ties between the two nations. We serve a diverse membership base, from multinational corporations to dynamic startups, all of whom contribute to the rich tapestry of our shared economic landscape.
aboutMission: Our mission is to be the leading catalyst for economic growth and cultural exchange between India and Japan, creating a prosperous and interconnected business ecosystem.
aboutObjective1: To promote and protect the trade, commerce, and industries of India and Japan.
aboutObjective2: To encourage and facilitate technical and economic collaboration between the two countries.
aboutObjective3: To provide a platform for networking and knowledge sharing among members.
aboutObjective4: To act as a representative body for the business community in matters of policy and trade.
aboutObjective5: To foster cultural understanding and strengthen the bonds of friendship between the people of India and Japan.
leadershipDescription: The dedicated professionals leading the Indo-Japan Chamber of Commerce.
advisorsDescription: Our esteemed advisors who provide strategic guidance and industry expertise.
legalTeamDescription: Our expert legal counsel, providing critical guidance on national and international law.
regionalChaptersDescription: The visionary leaders who laid the foundation of the Indo-Japan Chamber of Commerce and continue to guide our mission.
team_rahulMishra_bio:
Rahul Mishra is the Chairman of the Indo-Japan Chamber of Commerce (IJCC), Vice President of SEWA Foundation, and Managing Director of Aamida Infotech. With over 18 years of experience in international business development, operations, and consulting, he has played a pivotal role in fostering business, cultural, and educational collaborations between India and Japan.

He founded Aamida Consulting Services (ACS) in 2011, successfully expanding its operations across India while building sustainable and long-term partnerships. Prior to his entrepreneurial journey, Rahul held leadership roles in leading IT organizations including Oracle, IBM, SAP Labs, McAfee, MothersonSumi Infotech, Four Soft, and Nucleus Software, where he gained extensive expertise in global technology and operations.

An MBA in International Marketing from ICFAI, Hyderabad, Rahul is deeply passionate about the education sector, aamidainfotech, and information technologies. He is also associated with the Japan Foundation, and strongly believes in creating authentic, mutually beneficial, and long-lasting relationships. Through his leadership across business, non-profit, and cross-border platforms, Rahul Mishra continues to strengthen India’s global presence, especially in Indo-Japan relations.
team_gajendraBadgujar_bio: With a strong background in policy and strategy from his time at FICCI, Mr. Gajendra Badgujar provides invaluable guidance to the IJCC. He focuses on long-term strategic initiatives that enhance bilateral trade and investment opportunities.
team_prakashYadav_bio: Mr. Prakash Yadav combines his expertise in corporate affairs and the hospitality industry to support IJCC's mission. As MD of AJU Hotels, he has been a cornerstone in providing world-class hospitality to Japanese visitors and businesses in India.
team_neelamRamaiah_title: Vice-Chairman (Education), Ex. Director, University of Tokyo
team_neelamRamaiah_bio:
Dr. Neelam Ramaiah is a distinguished academic and researcher in Aquatic Biosciences with dual PhDs from the University of Tokyo (2001) and the University of Bombay (1990). She has a long-standing research association with the CSIR–National Institute of Oceanography (NIO), Goa and Mumbai, where she served in various roles from Junior Research Fellow to Research Associate.

She began her academic career as a Lecturer in Mumbai before moving to Japan as a MEXT Scholar at the University of Tokyo, where she later held positions as Visiting Associate Professor, Lecturer, and Associate Professor (2001–2017) at the Graduate School of Agricultural & Life Sciences (GSALS). From 2019–2020, she also served as Director of The University of Tokyo India Office, New Delhi, fostering academic and research collaborations between India and Japan.

Dr. Ramaiah has authored 26 research papers, presented at 13 international symposia, and contributed to 12 technical reports. She also co-translated and edited the Japanese book “Introduction to Fisheries and Aquatic Biology” (2011). Proficient in Japanese (JLPT N1), she continues to contribute to cross-cultural academic exchange and marine sciences research.
team_surajitKalita_bio: Mr. Surajit Kalita is a master of logistics and planning. His role as Vice-Chairman of Operations & Planning ensures the smooth execution of all IJCC events, delegations, and initiatives, making every interaction seamless and effective.
team_mukeshRanjan_bio: Mukesh Ranjan is a seasoned professional in HR, IT, and educational development. He has served as Deputy Director (General Affairs) at the National Industries Development Council Committee and as General Manager for the Digital India initiatives of the Krishna Sudarshan Charitable Trust. Passionate about bridging education and employment, he has led campus recruitment drives with Purnia University and represented Royal Metropolitan University, Kyrgyzstan, to guide Indian students toward medical education. Recognised with honors such as Best HR & IT Professional of the Year 2021 and the International Education Pride Award 2021, he is also an environmental activist and an invited speaker at international education and skills summits.
team_tomoyukiIwama_bio:
Mr. Tomoyuki Iwama is a seasoned international business and operations leader with over 30 years of global experience across Europe, Southeast Asia, and India. A graduate in Biology from the University of Tsukuba (1989), he has built a distinguished career with Yakult Honsha Co., Ltd., Japan, where he currently serves as General Manager for International Business Development and Global Operations Support.

Since 2007, he has also been Director of Yakult Danone India Pvt. Ltd., playing a key role in expanding Yakult’s presence in the Indian market. His prior international assignments include serving as Advisor at PT Yakult Indonesia Persada (2004–2007), Director at Yakult Malaysia (2003–2004), and Quality Control Manager at Yakult Europe and Yakult Netherlands (1994–2001), where he specialized in production management and establishing overseas manufacturing plants.

In addition to his corporate career, Mr. Iwama contributes to academia as an International Cooperation Advisor (India) at the University of Tsukuba’s Bureau of Global Initiatives (since 2025). Fluent in Japanese and English, with conversational proficiency in Indonesian and Malay, he is widely recognized for his cross-cultural leadership, strategic planning, and operational excellence in global business.
team_naveenVerma_bio: Mr. Naveen Verma brings his regulatory expertise as the Chairman of RERA Bihar to the chamber. His insights are crucial for navigating the complexities of the real estate and infrastructure sectors for Japanese investors in India.
team_anilKumarKhandelwal_title: Ex. General Manager, East Central Railway
team_anilKumarKhandelwal_bio: With a long and distinguished career in the Indian Railways, Mr. Anil Kumar Khandelwal provides strategic advice on infrastructure and transportation projects. His experience is vital for large-scale collaborations between India and Japan.
team_randeepRakwal_bio: Dr. Randeep Rakwal is a distinguished academic and researcher at Tsukuba University. His work in biotechnology has led to significant advancements and collaborative projects between Indian and Japanese research institutions, fostering a new generation of scientists.
team_kenichiroIwahori_bio: Mr. Kenichiro Iwahori brings a wealth of knowledge in international policy and cultural exchange. His work with the Sasakawa Foundation has been pivotal in creating numerous programs that promote mutual understanding and collaboration between the people of Japan and India.
team_markus_bio:
Mr. Markus, born on 22 July 1954 in Delhi, is a distinguished cultural ambassador and professional who has dedicated his career to strengthening ties between India and Japan. A graduate of the University of Delhi (1975), he developed an early passion for Japanese culture, beginning Japanese language studies in 1974 and achieving the top position in India in 1976. In 1977, he was invited to Japan by the Japan Foundation, marking the beginning of a lifelong connection with the country where he has resided for more than two decades.

As Managing Director of Asahi Travel Service, Mr. Markus has traveled extensively across India, particularly to the Buddhist circuit (over 300 visits), accompanying eminent Japanese scholars and Buddhist priests. His contribution to tourism was recognized in 1996, when Asahi Travel Service received a National Tourism Award from the then Prime Minister, Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee.

Beyond tourism, Mr. Markus is also deeply engaged in the cultural and academic spheres. A disciple of the renowned Rakugoka (traditional Japanese comedian) Tatekawa Danshi, he was honored with the stage name Tatekawa Danderi and has performed on stage alongside his mentor. In 2008, he authored the Japanese-language book “INDO RYU” (Indian Style), exploring Indian culture, and has since delivered over 150 lectures on Indian philosophy, culture, and business in Japan. His insights have been widely featured in Japanese newspapers, magazines, television programs, and radio broadcasts.

Through his multifaceted work, Mr. Markus has emerged as a bridge between India and Japan, promoting not only tourism but also cultural exchange, business collaboration, and human relationships.

He also holds various distinguished positions, including:

Governor

Vice President

Advisor

Visiting Lecturer

Lecturer
team_supraticGupta_bio: Dr. Supratic Gupta is a leading professor at IIT Delhi, specializing in materials science. He facilitates technical collaboration and R&D partnerships between top Indian and Japanese engineering institutions and companies.
team_maushumiBarooah_title: Ex. Director, Assam Technical Education Board
team_maushumiBarooah_bio: Dr. Maushumi Barooah has dedicated her career to advancing technical education. Her expertise helps the IJCC in developing skill-building programs and vocational training initiatives to meet the demands of Japanese industries.
team_rajeshMehta_bio:
Rajesh Mehta is a leading business consultant, entrepreneur, and public policy expert with over 20 years of cross-functional experience. He has worked with global corporations, SMEs, and technology-enabled startups, specializing in market entry for international companies, innovation consulting, and advocacy for Fortune 500 firms, business chambers, and public affairs organizations.

A prolific writer, he has contributed to leading publications such as Financial Express, First Post, The Daily Guardian, American Bazaar, The Diplomatist, and The Fair Observer, and authored reports on women entrepreneurship, innovation, water, and skill development.

Rajesh serves on the Executive Committee of the Centre for Trade, Promotion & Industry and was previously Adviser to the World Association of Small & Medium Enterprises (WASME). He has advised global organizations including Tekes, Finnode, Finpro (Finland), Indo-Scandic Organization (Sweden), and the European Business Technology Center, and has played a key role in helping international firms establish operations in India while enabling Indian companies to expand globally.

He has been actively engaged in US–India public policy through advisory roles with APCO Worldwide, SJ Consulting, and Red Fort Strategies, and also supports outsourcing and manufacturing initiatives in India. Alongside his business work, Rajesh is associated with several non-profits such as Jaipur Foot, End Poverty, and FAEA, and currently serves as a National Advisory Board Member of the Sewa Foundation.
team_jatinderKhanna_bio: Dr. Jatinder Khanna is an influential policy maker with a focus on education and culture. He helps guide the IJCC in its mission to foster deeper cultural ties and educational exchanges between India and Japan.
team_vinodKumarYadavendu_bio:
Ex Member of Bihar Legislative Assembly, Patna.

Life Member-Commonwealth ParliamentarianAssociation, London, (Bihar Branch)

Life Member-Indian History Congress, New Delhi

President - Gaya Nagari Pracharini Sabha

Former Head, PG Deptt. of Ancient Indian and Asian Studies, Magadh University, Bodhgaya

Ex member- Advisory Committee, Ministry of Education, Govt. of Bihar

Ex Member- Dr. K.P. Jaiswal Research Institute, Patna.
team_anjaliSharma_bio: As an advocate in the Supreme Court of India, Ms. Anjali Sharma provides critical legal counsel to the chamber. Her expertise in international law is essential for members navigating cross-border business transactions.
team_rajSingh_bio: Mr. Raj Singh has been a guiding force since the chamber's inception. Through Sunlite Consulting, he continues to provide strategic business advice to companies looking to enter the Indo-Japan corridor, with a focus on fostering growth in the Varanasi region.
team_lokendraRana_bio: With extensive experience in international sales, marketing, and operations, Lokendra Rana leads the Gaya chapter. His expertise is pivotal in driving business development and fostering cross-cultural partnerships in the region.
team_muazAhmed_bio:
Mr.Muaz Ahmed is a results-driven hospitality and sales professional with over 20 years of experience across retail sales, hospitality management, and international import–export operations in both European and Indian markets. He brings a strong track record in team leadership, business development, and cross-border trade, consistently driving business growth and building high-performing teams.
With deep expertise in navigating diverse cultural, commercial, and regulatory environments, Muaz has successfully expanded operations and identified new business opportunities across Europe, the UAE, and India. He is known for fostering long-term relationships with clients, partners, and stakeholders.
Passionate and strategic in approach, Muaz leverages his extensive industry knowledge and global experience to deliver sustainable growth and success in dynamic, fast-paced business environments.
team_dhruvHans_bio:
Mr. Dhruv (Hans Dhruv) is a seasoned Japanese language expert and Indo-Japan business professional with over 21 years of experience in Japanese language teaching, interpretation, translation, and corporate consulting. Having lived, studied, and worked in Japan for 8 years, he brings deep cultural understanding and business etiquette expertise.
Currently serving as Business Head – Japanese Services at Sewa Hospitality Services Pvt. Ltd., he has supported leading Japanese and Indian companies across automotive, manufacturing, electronics, and trading sectors. A JLPT N1 certified professional, Mr. Dhruv plays a key role in strengthening Indo-Japan communication, corporate training, and business collaboration initiatives at IJCC.
team_yokoTorii_bio:
Ms. Yoko Torii brings extensive experience in education, career counseling, and travel services across Japan and India. After beginning her career at a language school in Japan, she spent 17 years supporting Japanese students with career guidance and overseas study counseling. She later expanded her expertise by working with a travel agency in India, where she gained hands-on experience in inbound and outbound tour planning and operations.
Having lived in India for over 12 years, Ms. Torii considers it her personal mission to introduce and share the many charms of Japan with a wider Indian audience.
Japan offers countless reasons to captivate travelers. Since Japanese cuisine was recognized as a UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage in 2013, it has drawn food lovers from around the world. Geographically diverse, Japan stretches from Hokkaido in the north to Okinawa in the south, showcasing stunning seasonal beauty—from cherry blossoms in spring and vibrant autumn foliage to snow-covered winters. Visitors can enjoy world-class skiing in northern Japan and scuba diving in the clear waters of Okinawa.
Japan is also renowned for its safety, cleanliness, and trust-based society, where even lost belongings are returned and solo travelers can explore with confidence.
Driven by a genuine passion for this remarkable country, Ms. Torii remains deeply committed to promoting Japan as an exceptional and inspiring travel destination.
services_description: We offer a comprehensive suite of services to facilitate trade, education, and investment between India and Japan.
service_indian-schools_description: Strengthening educational and cultural ties between India and Japan for K-12 students and educators.
service_indian-universities_description: Building academic, cultural, and professional bridges for higher education students in India.
service_indian-smes_description: Support for Indian SMEs, MSMEs, startups, and entrepreneurs to engage with the Japanese market.
service_japanese-smes_description: Support for Japanese SMEs, MSMEs, and startups to enter and grow in the Indian market.
service_company-registration-jp-in_title: Company Registration: Japanese Companies in India
service_company-registration-jp-in_descr: End-to-end support for Japanese companies establishing a legal presence in India.
service_company-registration-in-jp_title: Company Registration: Indian Companies in Japan
service_company-registration-in-jp_descr: Comprehensive assistance for Indian companies looking to register and operate in Japan.
service_digital-services_description: Comprehensive support for Japanese startups and SMEs entering the Indian market.
service_startup-support_description: Fostering innovation and entrepreneurship by connecting startups with investors and markets.
service_management-training_description: Equipping Indian businesses with the proven principles of Japanese management.
servicedetail_indian-schools_description: The Indo-Japan Chamber of Commerce (IJCC) works to strengthen educational and cultural ties between India and Japan. For Indian schools, IJCC offers a wide range of programs and services designed to provide students and educators with international exposure, cultural understanding, and future career pathways.
servicedetail_indian-schools_cat1_point1: Facilitation of partnerships with Japanese schools for collaborative projects.
servicedetail_indian-schools_cat1_point2: Online and offline student exchange programs to build global perspectives.
servicedetail_indian-schools_cat1_point3: Virtual cultural exchange sessions (language, traditions, festivals, and student-led presentations).
servicedetail_indian-schools_cat2_point1: Curated study tours to Japan including school visits, university campus tours, and cultural immersion.
servicedetail_indian-schools_cat2_point2: Opportunities for students to experience Japanese classrooms, interact with peers, and understand Japan’s education system.
servicedetail_indian-schools_cat2_point3: Visits to leading institutions, industries, and cultural sites (e.g., Universal Studios, Bullet Train experience, Mt. Fuji).
servicedetail_indian-schools_cat3_point1: Japanese language learning modules for school students.
servicedetail_indian-schools_cat3_point2: Workshops on Japanese art, calligraphy, origami, martial arts, and tea ceremony.
servicedetail_indian-schools_cat3_point3: Exposure to Japanese work culture and discipline through interactive sessions.
servicedetail_indian-schools_cat4_point1: Guidance for students aspiring to pursue higher education in Japan.
servicedetail_indian-schools_cat4_point2: Seminars on scholarships, entrance requirements, and career opportunities in Japan.
servicedetail_indian-schools_cat4_point3: Linkages with Japanese universities and skill development programs.
servicedetail_indian-schools_cat5_point1: Professional development workshops for teachers on global teaching methodologies.
servicedetail_indian-schools_cat5_point2: Exchange opportunities for educators to learn from Japanese counterparts.
servicedetail_indian-schools_cat6_point1: Student homestay programs in Japan for immersive cultural learning (future initiative).
servicedetail_indian-schools_cat6_point2: Hosting Japanese students in Indian schools for reciprocal cultural sharing (future initiative).
servicedetail_indian-universities_descri: The Indo-Japan Chamber of Commerce (IJCC) is committed to building strong academic, cultural, and professional bridges between India and Japan. For universities and colleges in India, IJCC offers a range of services designed to enhance student exposure, global competencies, and career pathways.
servicedetail_indian-universities_cat1_p: Facilitation of MoUs between Indian and Japanese universities/colleges.
Short-term and long-term student exchange programs.
Collaborative research projects, joint seminars, and academic conferences.
servicedetail_indian-universities_cat2_p: Customized education tours to Japan including visits to universities, R&D centers, and industries.
Exposure to Japan’s advanced technologies, innovation practices, and industry–academia collaboration.
Cultural immersion experiences (temples, heritage sites, modern cities, and traditional arts).
servicedetail_indian-universities_cat3_p: Certificate and diploma programs in Japanese language.
Training in cross-cultural communication and workplace readiness.
Workshops on Japanese culture, etiquette, and business practices.
servicedetail_indian-universities_cat4_p: Guidance on pursuing higher education and research opportunities in Japan.
Career counseling for students aiming for international job markets.
Placement support under Japan’s Specified Skilled Worker (SSW) program and internships in Japanese companies.
servicedetail_indian-universities_cat5_p: Industry-relevant workshops on innovation, entrepreneurship, and management inspired by Japanese models.
Training modules on Kaizen, Lean Management, and Quality Circles.
Soft skills and intercultural competency development.
servicedetail_indian-universities_cat6_p: Exchange of faculty for lectures, workshops, and joint research.
Co-hosting of academic conferences, symposiums, and innovation fairs.
Access to Japanese academic networks and resources.
servicedetail_indian-universities_cat7_p: Opportunities for students to connect with Japanese peers, professionals, and entrepreneurs.
Participation in Indo-Japan youth summits, cultural festivals, and innovation challenges.
servicedetail_indian-smes_description: The Indo-Japan Chamber of Commerce (IJCC) offers targeted support for Indian SMEs, MSMEs, startups, and entrepreneurs looking to engage with the Japanese market, fostering growth and global competitiveness.
servicedetail_indian-smes_cat1_point1: Introduce Indian companies to potential Japanese partners, distributors, and investors.
servicedetail_indian-smes_cat1_point2: Facilitate joint ventures, technology transfer, and co-innovation projects.
servicedetail_indian-smes_cat2_point1: Workshops on Japanese management practices (Kaizen, Lean, TQM, Monozukuri).
servicedetail_indian-smes_cat2_point2: Training in Japanese language, culture, and business etiquette.
servicedetail_indian-smes_cat2_point3: Sector-specific programs (manufacturing, IT, healthcare, energy, food processing, etc.).
servicedetail_indian-smes_cat3_point1: Organize business delegations to Japan for factory visits, B2B meetings, and trade fairs.
servicedetail_indian-smes_cat3_point2: Host Japanese delegations in India for local networking and site visits.
servicedetail_indian-smes_cat4_point1: Guidance on entering the Japanese market (legal, compliance, certification, packaging standards).
servicedetail_indian-smes_cat4_point2: Assistance with exports/imports, IPR, and government schemes.
servicedetail_indian-smes_cat5_point1: Access to Japanese startup ecosystems, incubators, and VCs.
servicedetail_indian-smes_cat5_point2: Joint hackathons, accelerator tie-ups, and pilot projects with Japanese firms.
servicedetail_japanese-smes_description: The Indo-Japan Chamber of Commerce (IJCC) provides comprehensive support for Japanese SMEs, MSMEs, and startups aiming to enter and thrive in the Indian market, offering services from market research to talent acquisition.
servicedetail_japanese-smes_cat1_point1: Market research, sector analysis, and partner identification.
servicedetail_japanese-smes_cat1_point2: Assistance in navigating Indian regulatory frameworks and government connect.
servicedetail_japanese-smes_cat2_point1: Matchmaking with reliable Indian SMEs/MSMEs for suppliers, distributors, or JV partners.
servicedetail_japanese-smes_cat2_point2: Cultural orientation and training for Japanese managers working in India.
servicedetail_japanese-smes_cat3_point1: Organize inbound business delegations to India (factories, industrial clusters, government meetings).
servicedetail_japanese-smes_cat3_point2: Curate one-to-one meetings with Indian entrepreneurs and startups.
servicedetail_japanese-smes_cat4_point1: Support in recruitment of skilled Indian talent for Japanese companies (including SSW/TITP programs).
servicedetail_japanese-smes_cat4_point2: Facilitate internships, exchange programs, and training initiatives.
servicedetail_japanese-smes_cat5_point1: Co-development of products/solutions with Indian startups.
servicedetail_japanese-smes_cat5_point2: Partnerships in sectors like EVs, AI, robotics, agritech, healthcare, and clean energy.
servicedetail_company-registration-jp-in: Company Registration: Japanese Companies in India
IJCC provides end-to-end support for Japanese companies seeking to establish a legal presence in India, from strategic advisory on the best entry structure to post-incorporation compliance.
Advisory on Entry Strategy
Guidance on the best structure:
Wholly Owned Subsidiary (Private Limited Company)
Joint Venture with Indian Partner
Liaison / Branch / Project Office (RBI approval route)
Sector-specific compliance (FEMA, FDI policy, restricted sectors).
Company Incorporation Support
Preparation & filing with MCA (Ministry of Corporate Affairs).
Assistance with MoA & AoA drafting (aligned with Japanese parent company’s goals).
Digital signatures & Director Identification Number (DIN) processing.
Obtaining Certificate of Incorporation.
Regulatory & Legal Compliance
RBI approvals (for Liaison/Branch/Project office).
PAN, TAN & GST registration.
Import Export Code (IEC) for trading companies.
Compliance with FEMA, Companies Act, and local state laws.
Office & Infrastructure Solutions
Assistance in finding registered office address (temporary/virtual/long-term).
Support for setting up physical offices, warehouses, or industrial space.
Banking & Financial Setup
Facilitation of bank account opening for Japanese entities in India.
Guidance on foreign remittance and repatriation of profits.
Connections with Indian and Japanese banks operating in India.
HR & Talent Support
Recruitment of skilled Indian workforce.
Access to SSW/TITP programs for blue-collar needs.
Cross-cultural training for Japanese managers working in India.
Post-Incorporation Support
Ongoing legal, tax, and compliance advisory.
Secretarial services (ROC filings, board meetings, annual reports).
Advisory on expansion, mergers, acquisitions, or JV structuring.
servicedetail_company-registration-in-jp: Company Registration: Indian Companies in Japan
IJCC offers comprehensive assistance for Indian companies looking to register and operate in Japan, covering everything from legal structure advisory to post-incorporation support.
Advisory & Consultation
Guidance on the right entry structure in Japan:
Kabushiki Kaisha (KK) – equivalent to Private Limited Company.
Godo Kaisha (GK) – similar to LLP in India.
Branch Office of Indian company.
Representative Office (for market research, no commercial activity).
Sector-wise advisory (manufacturing, IT, food processing, services, trading, etc.).
Compliance overview: tax, labor laws, visa, and Japanese Commercial Code.
Company Incorporation Support
Drafting and filing documents (Articles of Incorporation, company seal, notarization).
Assistance with office address (registered office, virtual office, co-working space).
Support in opening Japanese bank accounts.
Registration with Legal Affairs Bureau in Japan.
Tax registration: National Tax Agency (NTA) for corporate tax, consumption tax, etc.
Regulatory & Compliance Assistance
Help with immigration/visa procedures for Indian founders or key employees.
Social insurance, payroll, and HR compliance setup.
Intellectual Property Rights (IPR) advisory – patents, trademarks in Japan.
Guidance on Japanese packaging, product quality, and safety standards.
Business Development Support
Connecting with Japanese distributors, investors, and partners.
Access to Japanese startup ecosystems, accelerators, and VCs.
Facilitating participation in trade fairs, expos, and B2B meetings in Japan.
Post-Incorporation Services
Accounting, taxation, and annual filings in Japan.
Virtual CFO/Compliance support.
Translation, interpretation, and cultural orientation for smooth business operations.
Additional IJCC Value-Add
Education & training for Indian founders on Japanese corporate culture and business etiquette.
Recruitment support for hiring Japanese/Indian bilingual staff.
Assistance with government incentives (JETRO programs, startup subsidies, SME grants).
servicedetail_digital-services_title: IJCC – Japanese Startup Support Services (India Entry Program)
servicedetail_digital-services_descripti: The Indo Japan Chamber of Commerce (IJCC) supports Japanese startups, SMEs, and innovation-driven companies in successfully entering, operating, and scaling in the Indian market. As a non-profit chamber based in New Delhi, IJCC acts as a trusted bridge between Japan and India, providing end-to-end facilitation, compliance guidance, and ecosystem access.
servicedetail_digital-services_cat1_poin: Entry strategy advisory (Representative Office / Liaison / JV / Partnerships)
Identification of Indian partners, distributors, and institutions
Support with local consultants, legal, and accounting partners
servicedetail_digital-services_cat2_poin: Visa sponsorship support for Japanese founders, executives, and technical experts
Guidance for Business Visa, Employment Visa, and Project-based visits
Invitation letters, institutional backing, and documentation support
Coordination with Indian institutions, schools, universities, and industry partners
On-ground support during official visits, delegations, and pilot programs
(IJCC acts as a facilitation and support body and does not issue visas directly.)
servicedetail_digital-services_cat3_poin: Assistance in setting up liaison offices, project offices, or partnerships
Cultural orientation and India business etiquette guidance
servicedetail_digital-services_cat4_poin: Collaboration with Indian schools, universities, and research institutions
Support for pilot projects, product testing, and user research
Academic & institutional partnerships under Indo-Japan cooperation
Japan–India education and innovation exchange programs
servicedetail_digital-services_cat5_poin: FCRA advisory support for eligible Indian partner organizations
Guidance on FCRA registration, prior permission, and compliance processes
Structuring Japan–India funding collaborations in line with Indian regulations
Coordination with legal and compliance professionals
(IJCC does not provide legal certification but connects startups with authorized experts.)
servicedetail_digital-services_cat6_poin: Access to IJCC member network across India
Participation in delegations, forums, and business events
Long-term relationship management and expansion advisory
servicedetail_startup-support_descriptio: The Indo-Japan Chamber of Commerce (IJCC) is committed to fostering innovation and entrepreneurship by connecting Indian startups with Japanese expertise, investors, and markets. Through its network of industry leaders, government bodies, and academic institutions, IJCC provides end-to-end support for startups to grow globally.
servicedetail_startup-support_cat1_point: Access to experienced mentors from India and Japan in business strategy, technology, and global expansion.
Structured incubation programs with guidance on product development, scaling, and market positioning.
Knowledge sessions on Japanese business culture, negotiation practices, and corporate expectations.
servicedetail_startup-support_cat2_point: Facilitation of connections with Japanese venture capital firms, angel investors, and corporate funds.
Assistance in preparing investor-ready business pitches and business plans.
Hosting investor–startup networking events and demo days.
servicedetail_startup-support_cat3_point: Support for Indian startups seeking entry into the Japanese market.
Partner search and business matchmaking with Japanese companies.
Assistance with regulatory compliance, legal frameworks, and business setup in Japan.
servicedetail_startup-support_cat4_point: Joint India–Japan startup challenges, hackathons, and innovation competitions.
Opportunities for collaboration with Japanese universities, R&D labs, and corporations.
Access to government-supported innovation programs (e.g., JICA, JETRO, NEDO collaborations).
servicedetail_startup-support_cat5_point: Workshops on entrepreneurship, intellectual property rights, and global business practices.
Training in Kaizen, Lean Startup methodology, and Japanese management systems.
Exposure visits to Japan for learning from successful startups and incubators.
servicedetail_startup-support_cat6_point: Participation in Indo-Japan startup summits, exhibitions, and conferences.
Opportunities to showcase products/services to Japanese businesses and investors.
Access to IJCC’s cross-border network of industry professionals, academics, and policymakers.
servicedetail_management-training_descri: The Indo-Japan Chamber of Commerce (IJCC) offers specialized training programs designed to equip Indian SMEs, MSMEs, and entrepreneurs with the proven principles of Japanese management. These programs blend global best practices with local business needs, enabling enterprises to enhance productivity, quality, and competitiveness.
servicedetail_management-training_cat1_p: Practical training on Kaizen (continuous improvement) techniques.
Focus on cost reduction, waste elimination, and efficiency enhancement.
Case studies of successful Japanese companies.
servicedetail_management-training_cat2_p: Principles of Lean Manufacturing and Lean Startup methodology.
Tools for process optimization, time management, and value creation.
Strategies to build scalable and sustainable business operations.
servicedetail_management-training_cat3_p: Training in TQM practices followed by global Japanese corporations.
Establishment of quality circles within organizations.
Customer satisfaction and defect-free production methods.
servicedetail_management-training_cat4_p: Hands-on learning of Seiri, Seiton, Seiso, Seiketsu, and Shitsuke (5S).
Implementation of workplace discipline and efficiency culture.
Creating safe, organized, and productive work environments.
servicedetail_management-training_cat5_p: Japanese approaches to employee engagement and team spirit.
Building loyalty, discipline, and responsibility in workforce management.
servicedetail_management-training_cat6_p: Insights on Japanese R&D and innovation-driven growth.
Strategic planning for SMEs and entrepreneurs.
Business diversification and global market entry strategies.
servicedetail_management-training_cat7_p: Training in Japanese business communication, negotiation, and etiquette.
Preparing Indian entrepreneurs for collaborations with Japanese companies.
Bridging cultural differences in global partnerships.
members_description: Join us to foster Indo-Japan collaboration across trade, education, technology, and cultural exchanges.
members_associatesDescription: IJCC is powered by a strong network of members, associates, and support organisations who share our vision of strengthening Indo-Japan relations. Our members include businesses, educational institutions, and professionals; our associates collaborate with us on programs and initiatives; and our support organisations comprise industry bodies, government agencies, and cultural institutions that enable IJCC to deliver impactful projects. Together, they form the backbone of IJCC’s mission to connect India and Japan through business, education, culture, and innovation.
membershipDetails_authRequiredDescriptio: Please log in or create an account to apply for membership.
membershipDetails_enrollmentDescription: Submit your profile and application form. Upon approval, a welcome letter and membership certificate will be issued. You will then be prompted for payment.
membershipTier_individual_eligibility: Freelancers, consultants, independent professionals across domains interested in Indo-Japan collaboration.
membershipTier_individual_benefit1: Invites to Indo-Japan networking events & webinars
membershipTier_individual_benefit2: Access to cultural exchange and educational programs
membershipTier_individual_benefit5: Eligibility for mentorship and project collaboration
membershipTier_startup_eligibility: Early-stage startups, growing SMEs, bootstrapped or VC-backed Indian ventures.
membershipTier_startup_benefit2: Support in market linkages and B2B matchmaking
membershipTier_startup_benefit3: Invitations to pitch events and startup delegations
membershipTier_startup_benefit5: Visibility on IJCC's startup showcases & newsletters
membershipTier_association_eligibility: Non-profit organizations, industry bodies, trade associations, academic institutions, Pvt / Ltd / LLP / Section 8 Company.
membershipTier_corporate_eligibility: Registered MSMEs, LLPs, joint ventures, established private limited companies with a Japan interest.
membershipTier_corporate_benefit1: Listing on IJCC website & business directories
membershipTier_corporate_benefit2: Priority participation in Indo-Japan trade missions
membershipTier_corporate_benefit4: Access to advisory panels on trade & legal matters
membershipTier_largeCorporate_eligibilit: MNCs, large Indian corporates, institutions, and think tanks engaged in Indo-Japan programs.
membershipTier_largeCorporate_benefit1: Co-hosting opportunities for major events & summits
membershipTier_largeCorporate_benefit2: Direct access to senior officials, embassies & policy bodies
membershipTier_largeCorporate_benefit4: Brand visibility across IJCC platforms & delegations
membershipTier_largeCorporate_benefit5: Joint whitepapers, reports, and knowledge partnerships
membershipApplication_description: Please fill out the form below to apply for membership. We're excited to have you join us.
membershipForm_toastSuccessDescription: Your application has been received! You will now be redirected to complete the payment.

membershipForm_partA_title: Part A: Company & Primary Contact Information
membershipForm_partA_description: All fields are required unless marked optional.

membershipForm_japanInterest_export: Exporting our Products/Services to the Japanese Market

membershipForm_marketObjectives_label: 18. Specific Objectives for the Japanese Market
membershipForm_marketObjectives_placehol: e.g., \"We want to partner with a Japanese auto-component manufacturer for technical collaboration,\" or \"We are seeking a distributor in Osaka for our specialty teas.\"
membershipForm_declaration_label: I/We have read and understood the membership criteria and agree to abide by the rules and regulations of the India Japan Chamber of Commerce (IJCC). The information provided in this application is true and correct to the best of my knowledge.

membershipForm_validation_pincode_min: Pincode must be at least 6 characters.
membershipForm_validation_pincode_max: Pincode can be at most 10 characters.
membershipForm_validation_directors: Please list at least one director.
membershipForm_validation_mobileNumber: A valid mobile number is required.
membershipForm_validation_emailAddress: A valid email address is required.
membershipForm_validation_coreBusinessAc: Please select a core business activity.
membershipForm_validation_japanInterest: You have to select at least one interest.
membershipForm_validation_companyDescrip: Description must be at least 50 words.
Description must be less than 1000 characters (approx. 150 words).
membershipForm_validation_marketObjectiv: Please provide more detail on your objectives.
news_description: Stay informed with the latest updates on Indo-Japan business and cultural relations.
news_article_1_title: Mela Mela Anime Japan returns with double the Japanese content in Delhi
news_article_1_description: The popular Anime and Japanese cultural festival, 'Mela Mela Anime Japan,' is set to return to New Delhi, promising an even bigger and more immersive experience for fans.
news_article_2_title: Japanese autumn ‘Matsuri’ Utsav brings authentic Japanese experience in Gurugram on Oct 11
news_article_2_description: Gurugram witnessed a slice of Japan as the AJU Japanese hotel, in association with the Indo-Japan Chamber of Commerce (IJCC) and other Japanese organizations, hosted the ‘Matsuri’ Utsav.
news_article_3_title: IJCCI, AIMA Forge Strategic Partnership to Boost Indo-Japanese SME, Edn, and Biz Collaboration
news_article_3_description: The Indo-Japan Chamber of Commerce and Industry (IJCCI) and the All India Management Association (AIMA) have signed an MoU to foster collaboration between Indian and Japanese SMEs, educational institutions, and businesses.
events_page_subtitle: Join our events to network, learn, and grow your business connections.
event_1_title: Japan Business Tour for Indian Doctors
event_1_description: An exclusive business tour for Indian doctors to explore healthcare opportunities and collaborations in Japan.
event_2_title: Exclusive India Business Delegation Trip to Japan
event_2_description: An exclusive business delegation trip for Indian business leaders to explore opportunities in Japan. More details coming soon.
event_3_location: Star Mall Outer Plaza & AJU Nagomi Family Dining. Contact: 98711 59420 (WhatsApp)
event_3_description: Experience the vibrant culture of Japan in India! Organized by AJU Japanese Hotel.
event_4_title: INDIA - JAPAN: SHAPING THE FUTURE IN RAPIDLY EVOLVING BUSINESS ECOSYSTEM
event_4_description: A business seminar featuring presentations from 4 states, a Q&A session, and discussions on BIS, Solar Power, IPR & Data Privacy.
event_5_location: Saket District Centre, Sector 6, Pushp Vihar, New Delhi - 110017
event_5_description: A Day of Culture, Business and Friendship
event_7_description: Experience Japan Beyond Textbooks. A curated educational experience for Indian school students and educators to gain first-hand exposure to Japanese culture, education, and innovation. Contact us for program highlights and booking details.
contact_subtitle: We're here to help. Reach out to us with any questions or inquiries.
